name: Kolibri
description: The offline-first platform for teaching and learning with technology without requiring the Internet.

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: Data can be accessed/exported from Kolibri in a number of ways, including secure synchronization between devices, CSV export either offline or from the centralized Kolibri Data Portal (https://kolibri.readthedocs.io/en/latest/manage/data.html?#import-and-export-users-from-a-csv-file), or via a variety of REST API endpoints, depending on needs.

dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is collected and stored but NOT distributed.
dataPrivacySecurity.dataPrivacySecurity:
Kolibri limits data collection to only what is needed to enable a good user experience. Non-aggregate data is retained on local devices only unless the user explicitly connects to another device or remote server. Protections are four-fold: 
- We avoid collecting many common forms of PII in the Kolibri Learning Platform, e.g. we don’t store email addresses or phone numbers, or birth dates (just the optional birth year). 
- The demographic data (birth year and gender) fields are optional, and are not prerequisites for using the platform, allowing users for whom this information is more sensitive to opt out. 
 - Personal data that is stored in the offline platform is protected by industry standard authentication and role-based authorization techniques, and only made available to the user themselves or to someone authenticated as an administrator. 
 - When anonymized demographic data is reported from a device, it is reported in aggregate, in the form of the mean and standard deviation of the birth years, and the counts of users by gender. For devices with small numbers of users, these aggregate statistics are not calculated, to minimize identifiability.

sdgs.relevance: By being designed for the needs of learners in low-resource environments first, Kolibri addresses SDG4 because it is focused on equitable quality education to ensure that all learners have the potential to access quality learning experiences.

The Kolibri Learning Platform does not collect any email addresses, and includes warnings for installation administrators, advising them of their role as data handlers. Since data is typically stored locally in this project, Learning Equality has also entered into Data Processing Agreements when data is processed through Learning Equality’s servers, on a case-by-case basis.
